resources.name: Autism Speaks
resources.description: Dedicated to promoting solutions, across the spectrum and throughout the life span, for the needs of individuals with autism and their families.

resources.name: The Autism Research Institute (ARI)
resources.description: Focuses on researching the causes of autism and developing safe and effective treatments.

resources.name: National Autistic Society (UK)
resources.description: The UK's leading charity for people on the autism spectrum and their families. Provides support, guidance, and campaigns for improved rights and services.

resources.name: CHADD (Children and Adults with Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder)
resources.description: Provides education, advocacy, and support for individuals with ADHD.

resources.name: Understood.org
resources.description: Resources for learning and thinking differences, including ADHD, dyslexia, and dyscalculia.

resources.name: Occupational Therapy (OT)
resources.description: Helps individuals develop or regain skills needed for daily living and working, often focusing on sensory integration, fine motor skills, and self-care.

resources.name: Speech and Language Therapy (SLT)
resources.description: Assists with communication challenges, including understanding and using language, social communication, and feeding/swallowing difficulties.

resources.name: Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)
resources.description: A therapy based on the science of learning and behavior, often used to increase helpful behaviors and decrease harmful or learning-interfering behaviors.

resources.name: DIR/Floortime
resources.description: A developmental relationship-based approach focusing on emotional development, communication, and interaction through play.

resources.name: Sensory Integration Therapy
resources.description: Helps children process sensory information more effectively through structured exposure to sensory input.

resources.name: Child Mind Institute
resources.description: Independent nonprofit dedicated to transforming the lives of children and families struggling with mental health and learning disorders.

resources.name: National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI)
resources.description: Provides advocacy, education, support, and public awareness so that all individuals and families affected by mental illness can build better lives.

resources.name: Parent Coaching & Support Groups
resources.description: Connecting with other parents facing similar challenges can provide invaluable emotional support and practical advice. Look for local or online groups.

resources.name: Government Disability Benefits (Country Specific)
resources.description: Research national and local government programs offering financial support for individuals with disabilities and their families (e.g., SSI in the US, DLA/PIP in the UK).

resources.name: Insurance Navigation
resources.description: Understanding and utilizing health insurance benefits for therapies and support services.

resources.name: Grant Programs
resources.description: Various non-profit organizations offer grants for specific needs like therapy, equipment, or respite care.

resources.name: Book: 'NeuroTribes: The Legacy of Autism and the Future of Neurodiversity' by Steve Silberman
resources.description: A comprehensive look at the history and understanding of autism.

resources.name: Book: 'Uniquely Human: A Different Way of Seeing Autism' by Barry M. Prizant
resources.description: Offers a compassionate perspective on understanding autism.

resources.name: Website: Thinking Person's Guide to Autism
resources.description: A source of evidence-based information from autistic people, parents, and professionals.

resources.name: App: Proloquo2Go (AAC)
resources.description: A symbol-based Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC) app for those who have difficulty speaking.

resources.name: App: Calm or Headspace
resources.description: Mindfulness and meditation apps that can be helpful for managing stress and anxiety for both parents and children.

resources.name: Local Parent Support Groups
resources.description: Often host workshops and training sessions on various topics related to neurodiversity and parenting.

resources.name: Online Courses & Webinars
resources.description: Many organizations offer online training covering specific strategies, therapies, or advocacy skills.

resources.name: Therapist-Led Training
resources.description: Some therapy providers offer parent training programs as part of their services.
